Re: Famous Type 1's (Athletes, Musicians, Everyday Heroes, etc)

Options

‎06-13-2012 10:17 PM

You can have Bret... I'm still keeping Halle!  AND... Halle was dx'd T1 and put on insulin; but then, she reported she had "cured" herself of T1 with diet and exercise, weaned herself off insulin, and was now a T2 (ca. 2002?).  Of course, that isn't possible; in all likelihood, she was a T2 all along - but as a relativy young, fit (super)model, docs assumed T1; the consensus of docs reporting on her "cure" was that she was T2 all along, but misdix'd at the start.  She took a lot of heat for claiming she'd "cured" herself of T1.  I'll still keep her tho....  w.

Wayne T1 May 1966
MDI; 46u Lantus Basal

Sonia Sotomayor on the Supreme Court diagnosed at age 8 Adam Morrison...played basketball at Gonzaga when he was diagnosed Gary Hall Jr Elliot Yamin and Crystal Bowersox from American Idol
Diagnosed T1 January 1987
Pumping since 2001
Diagnosed Raynaud's January 2010
Diagnosed Lupus January 2013

‎06-13-2012 10:28 PM

Coastal,

 

Brett is already spoken for....Regina claimed him a long time ago! Here is a pic of Regina's daughter, when she and Regina went to see Brett. He's in the pic too.

 

http://community.diabetes.org/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/402

 

*******

 

Ben Vareen has not been mentioned yet, he is a Type 2.

 

*******

 

I would also be another to include my internist. He IS *the* MOST knowledgable physician for all things Type 1. I would almost bet that he is Type 1. I keep forgetting to ask him. For the girls...he's hot too!  

 

Trisha



Trisha

IDDM (Type 1 Autoimmune) 30+ many more years ~ Currently using MDI & Minimed CGM ~
Check out my diabetes blog!

All brittle means, is that one has great fluctuations, which is pretty much hallmark for Type 1's. Some more so than others. - me

First light brings a new day, new hope, new wisdom, and a chance to start fresh again. - me

If everyone were dealt the same amount of cards, there would be no challenges in life. Challenges are part of life's lessons, to teach us to grow in all aspects, and to learn what we need to learn, to make it in this world. Life was not meant to be fair. -me

"WE, the PEOPLE....."

~ New Type 1 Info ~ Insulin, Test Strips, Lancets, and other meds ~ Kidney Damage Info ~



*****************
Sidenote to new members....please put which type of diabetes you have, in your signature area. T1's and T2's cross post on these forums, and it is imperative that we all know which type one is. This is so that no misinformation is given to anyone. Type 1 and Type 2 are two totally absolute different diseases with different causes, thus making self-management very different. Thank you!, and welcome to the forums.
*****************
